title: The Hash of Infinity
detailedDescription: Python's hash function for infinity returns a special value: 314159, which is 10^5 × π (pi). Similarly, hash(float('-inf')) returns -314159. This mathematical easter egg shows Python developers' attention to mathematical elegance even in internal implementations. The choice of π (pi) for infinity's hash is a beautiful mathematical reference.
